page.title: 16Mr.& Mrs.Hill of Monks Kirby
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Hill have lived in Monks Kirby since 1964. Mrs Hill thinks the village is not as good as before. Because there are less elderly people and more commuters.They have seen an increase in traffic through the village due to school coaches and the midland red bus service.When Mr.and Mrs.Hill came to Monks Kirby the vicar was reverend Fag.They told us King Alfred's daughter Alfreada came to the village in the 9th century.Also there was a market of which Henry V11,gave the charter and there was a belltower seperate from the churches on the site where the Bell Inn is today probably where it gets it's name from.
